author: Nirnimesh Kumar
text:
The complaint was filed by Jaitley in connection with alleged corruption in DDCA

A local court on Wednesday summoned Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and five other AAP leaders on a defamation complaint filed by Union Finance Minister Arun Jaitley in connection with alleged corruption in the Delhi and District Cricket Association (DDCA).

Summoning all the accused, Chief Metropolitan Magistrate Sumit Dass asked them to appear before the court on April 7.

“The allegations are not only insulting but jeeringly taunting and provocative. I have no hesitation to hold that the allegations levelled by the respondents [Mr. Kejriwal and five others] are derogatory in nature and amount to slander and libel,’’ Mr. Dass said in his order.

Alluding to the statements and the Facebook and Twitter posts by the accused, Mr. Dass said, “The statements have exposed the complainant [Mr. Jaitley] to ridicule, hatred and contempt among the right-thinking members of society and lowered his reputation.”

The court also summoned AAP leaders Ashutosh, Kumar Vishwas, Raghav Chadha, Deepak Bajpai and Sanjay Singh after recording the statements of Mr. Jaitley and his other witnesses in support of the allegation of defamation.
title: Court summons Kejriwal in defamation case
